creator: sabedard@maptuit.com
text:
The ajp13 connector seems to hang when serving static content from the tomcat 
service.  This is being used on a Linux system with multiple ajp13 services 
running on differnent ports (it doesn't seem to happen with only one ajp13 
service running).  

This is an intermittant problem. It will happen every 1 out of 2 tries on a 
page that has 20 small images and 6 .js file that need to be downloaded.  Often 
the following stacktrack will appear when the browser stop button is pressed 
after waiting a few minutes:

java.net.SocketException: Connection reset by peer: Connection reset by peer
        at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead(Native Method)
        at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:86)
        at org.apache.tomcat.service.connector.TcpConnector.receiveFully
(TcpConnector.java:150)
        at org.apache.tomcat.service.connector.TcpConnector.receive
(TcpConnector.java:121)
        at 
org.apache.tomcat.service.connector.Ajp13ConnectionHandler.processConnection
(Ajp13ConnectionHandler.java:146)

This same stacktrace will also appear if apache is restarted (even though there 
should be no connections to the webserver at the time). 

Both mod_jk.so-eapi and mod_jk.so-noeapi from /builds/jakarta-
tomcat/release/v3.2.2/bin/linux/i386 were tried with similar results. 

We have tried both 3.2.1 tomcat and 3.2.2 tomcast with similary results.  

For clairification please contact sabedard@maptuit.com

Thanks,
         Shawn

creator: Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
text:
I am not aware of any general problems with respect to Tomcat 3.2.3 or 3.3
serving static content through Ajp13. Also, there isn't enough detail in
this report to attempt to duplicate the problem.  Though there is an offer
to provide more detail, this bug is logged against 3.2.1 and I prefer to
mark this one "invalid"

Please open an new bug with additional detail if the problem still exists
in a current version of Tomcat 3.x.  I would recommend trying Tomcat 3.3
since that is where active development is continuing for Tomcat 3.x.  Thanks.
